None of the pro players like him as much as the other champs.  Simply a matter of preference.  That's really all it comes down to.  Recent buffs to The Black Cleaver, Zz'rot Portal and his R have made him God-tier.  I wouldn't be surprised if we start to see him in professional play, although I hope that nobody actually picks him up.  I like that he's underrated and I would hate to see Riot nerf him.  

If you take a look at his kit, he has so much potential to become incredibly tanky while also having the same potential to do incredible damage.  People like to downplay his silence, but it's actually one of the most useful hard CC's in this game.  When you're silenced you can't flash, can't use abilities and you can't even use Thresh's lantern.  All you can do is run around and hope you don't die.  That silence is some of the best peel in this game.  Furthermore, since most of his damage is mobile you are able to keep up your damage almost 100% of the time.  Nobody can out-run you and it takes more than one (usually 3-4 if you build right) champions to lock you down because the passive resistances, damage reduction and CC reduction on your W is just so fucking good.  

He doesn't really have any glaring weaknesses since Patch 5.8.  I really like to run him in the top lane or in the jungle and use Smite with TP or Flash.  Challenging Smite/Cinderhulk, The Black Cleaver, Boots of Swiftness and Zz'Rot Portal are all so incredibly good on him.  He powerspikes hard after I get those first four fairly cheap items.  When I pick up Alacrity I can consistently keep over 600 MS while I'm running by a turret due to the Zz'Rot Portal passive and some other MS boosts.  Due to the passive on his W, he can get a total of 171 armor and magic resistance FROM ONLY TWO ITEMS, two points in the defensive tree and scaling seals/glyphs.  That doesn't even count his base armor and MR or the damage/cc reduction on his W active.  No other champion can boast these kind of stats.  

I'm really happy with Garen.  Riot's new itemization has really allowed him to become one of a kind.

Garen is actually quite effective, but people don't build him correctly. Unlike a lot of other bruisers, you can't load Garen down with four or five defensive items and expect him to churn out the damage. In fact, due to the passive on his W, you should be building one less defensive item on Garen compared to other bruisers since it makes up the difference.

Garen isn't meant to be a tank. If you try to build him like a tank, he'll do no damage. The most he can do to peel and protect his squishies is silence someone, and his initiation is very poor. Garen is an anti-carry, which means instead of being the tank for your squishies, you jump the front line and start beating the hell out of theirs. If you build correctly, a flash-Q-E-R will absolutely delete just about any fed marksman or mage. The difference between playing him like this and an assassin is that assassins get blown up if focused while attacking the enemy carry. Garen, however, will not falter.

Your typical build should look something like this:
{{item:3071}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3143}} {{item:3156}}  {{item:3035}} and {{item:3111}} or {{item:3047}} 
A mix of offense and defense, but leaning toward offense.

I really like to use {{item:3512}} {{item:3009}}.  

If you run scaling armor/magic resistance runes, then he can hit 109 armor and magic resistance from one "defensive" item at level 18.  Since Zz'Rot is so easy to build early game and since it provides so much tankiness (and utility) it allows you to gauge whether or not you'll need to buy another defensive item easily and still remain safe and durable until then.  Since there are so many %HP spells and items out there, it really works in Garen's favor to use healthless items.  Besides, you're running around the map so fast with the swifties and the portal that nobody can catch you and nobody can run away from you.
